bibl.note: This document is a short letter by Charles W. Dixon to Adam Fergusson, dated May 30, 1846. Dixon writes that he intends to keep Fergusson's military coat, as it fits him quite well. He also wishes to leave Fergusson a personal letter that was left in the coat pocket.

div.p: Having used your Uniform coat a few days and finding it fits me I conclude to take it with me. I expected to have gone to see you about it had you been at home. but I learned you would be absent until tomorrow which time would in all probability be too late for me
In using it I found it contained a (letter or at least a piece of paper with your name upon it but have not examined it to see what was the contents) which I enclose to you
